result.execSummary:
The defendant Tylor T Torstenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Submit DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tylor T Torstenson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for early discharge from probation pursuant to Sec. 973.09(3)(d)
from DOC to Court re: early discharge recommendation

Defendant Tylor T Torstenson in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on progress with DA. State advises of offer made to Defendant. Defendant wants to accept offer. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess any firearms. Any firearms are to be turned over to Sturgeon Bay PD.

Defendant Tylor T Torstenson in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
